questions.question_text: I prefer to make decisions without consulting my team
Team input is essential for effective decision-making
I let team members work independently with minimal supervision
Clear directives from leadership are necessary for team success
I encourage team collaboration and consensus-building
Team members should have freedom to choose their approach

authoritarian.title: Low Authoritarian Style
authoritarian.description: You rarely use authoritarian leadership approaches. You tend to avoid top-down decision making and prefer collaborative methods.
recommendations: Consider situations where directive leadership might be needed
Practice giving clear instructions when urgency is required
Balance collaboration with decisive action when necessary

authoritarian.title: Moderate Authoritarian Style
authoritarian.description: You balance authoritarian approaches appropriately, using directive leadership when the situation calls for it.
recommendations: Continue to assess when directive vs collaborative approaches work best
Develop skills in both leadership styles
Communicate the reasoning behind your leadership choices

authoritarian.title: High Authoritarian Style
authoritarian.description: You prefer directive, top-down leadership approaches and like to maintain control over decisions and processes.
recommendations: Consider incorporating more team input in non-urgent situations
Practice delegating authority to develop team members
Be mindful of team morale and engagement levels

democratic.title: Low Democratic Style
democratic.description: You tend to make decisions independently rather than seeking team input and collaboration.
recommendations: Practice involving team members in decision-making processes
Ask for input even on decisions you could make alone
Create regular opportunities for team feedback and suggestions

democratic.title: Moderate Democratic Style
democratic.description: You sometimes involve your team in decisions and value their input when appropriate.
recommendations: Increase team involvement in strategic decisions
Develop better processes for gathering and incorporating feedback
Practice facilitating team discussions and consensus-building

democratic.title: High Democratic Style
democratic.description: You strongly value team input and collaboration in decision-making processes. You believe in shared leadership.
recommendations: Continue fostering team collaboration and shared ownership
Ensure democratic processes don't slow down urgent decisions
Help team members develop decision-making skills

laissez_faire.title: Low Laissez-Faire Style
laissez_faire.description: You prefer to stay closely involved and provide regular guidance rather than giving complete autonomy.
recommendations: Practice giving team members more independence
Trust your team to make decisions within their expertise
Focus on outcomes rather than controlling processes

laissez_faire.title: Moderate Laissez-Faire Style
laissez_faire.description: You balance oversight with autonomy, giving team members freedom while maintaining appropriate guidance.
recommendations: Continue to calibrate the right level of autonomy for each team member
Provide clear expectations while allowing flexibility in execution
Regular check-ins to ensure team members feel supported

laissez_faire.title: High Laissez-Faire Style
laissez_faire.description: You strongly believe in giving team members complete autonomy and minimal supervision. You trust them to self-manage.
recommendations: Ensure team members have the skills and resources for independence
Maintain regular check-ins to provide support when needed
Be available for guidance while respecting their autonomy

scoring.description: Groups questions into leadership styles and scores each group separately. Provides detailed interpretations for each style.
